description: Numbers n such that n-2 and n+2 are consecutive primes.
comments: All terms are multiples of 3. Minimal first difference is 6. - _Zak Seidov_, May 15 2013
links: Zak Seidov, Table of n, a(n)/3 for n=1..1000
mathematica: f[n_]:=PrimeQ[n-2]&&PrimeQ[n+2]; lst={};Do[If[f[n],AppendTo[lst,n]],{n,7,8!,2}];lst (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Oct 09 2009 *)Select[Range[9,1432,6],PrimeQ[#-2]&&PrimeQ[#+2]&] (* _Zak Seidov_, May 15 2013 - just for terms in DATA *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
